# The `SUnit` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Scheduling unit. This is a node in the scheduling DAG. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

  name={<><a href="#a8926b25df7254ba2730fa5d7ec139862">getDepth</a> () const</>}>

## Description {#details}

Scheduling unit. This is a node in the scheduling DAG.

Definition at line 242 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/scheduledag-h">ScheduleDAG.h</a>.

### isBoundaryNode() {#a7406c398c67e53ee3937bf2b6df1c64e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::SUnit::isBoundaryNode () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Boundary nodes are placeholders for the boundary of the scheduling region.

BoundaryNodes can have DAG edges, including Data edges, but they do not correspond to schedulable entities (e.g. instructions) and do not have a valid <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. Consequently, always check for boundary nodes before accessing an associative data structure keyed on node <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/scheduledag-h/#l00358">358</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/scheduledag-h">ScheduleDAG.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
